title: pyproject.toml polish: keywords, URLs, classifiers
description: Add keywords field: tts, text-to-speech, mcp, language-learning, elevenlabs, aws-polly, openai. Add Repository URL to project.urls. Expand classifiers: Intended Audience :: Education, Environment :: Console, Topic :: Education. Consider updating Development Status from Alpha to Beta.

title: Expand OpenAI section in README
description: README OpenAI Voices section (lines 261-277) is sparse compared to ElevenLabs and Polly sections. Add: model selection guidance (tts-1 vs tts-1-hd trade-offs), multilingual capabilities note, default model (tts-1), character limit (4096 per request, auto-chunked).

title: Clarify install command help text
description: cli.py install command docstring (line 658) just says 'Register the MCP server with Claude Desktop.' Doesn't explain: writes to ~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json, sets env vars, requires restart. Also no mention of macOS-only limitation in help text (warning only at runtime).

title: Generalize install command for non-Claude clients
description: cli.py install command (line 637) only writes Claude Desktop config. Options: (1) detect active client and write appropriate config, (2) add --client flag (claude/cursor/windsurf), (3) document manual setup and keep install Claude-only. Currently macOS-only for Claude Desktop path.

title: Truncate Polly voice list in unknown voice error
description: ElevenLabs truncates voice list to 10 in error messages (elevenlabs.py line 211-215). Polly and OpenAI show all voices. Polly has 93 voices = very long error. Standardize: truncate to 10 with '... (N total)' across all providers.

title: Client-agnostic MCP support
description: Epic: Make langlearn-tts work well with all MCP clients (Cursor, Windsurf, Cody, OpenAI, custom), not just Claude Desktop. The MCP server protocol is already client-agnostic — this epic covers the UX tooling, documentation, and defaults that are currently Claude-specific.

title: Add README sections for non-Claude MCP clients
description: Add setup instructions for Cursor, Windsurf, Cody/VS Code, and generic MCP clients. Currently README only has 'Claude Desktop Setup' section. Include manual JSON config examples for each client. The server entry point (uvx --from langlearn-tts langlearn-tts-server) works universally.
close_reason: Added MCP setup sections for Cursor, Windsurf, and generic clients

title: Explicit provider factory signatures instead of **kwargs
close_reason: Only one kwarg (model) exists, passed from one call site. Explicit signatures would force parameter alignment across 3 factories for zero practical benefit. No bug surface.

title: OpenAI TTS Backend
description: Add OpenAI as a TTS provider. Broad adoption — users likely already have an OpenAI API key. 6 built-in voices, 50+ languages. Setup: pip install openai + OPENAI_API_KEY env var. Pricing: $15/1M chars (tts-1), $30/1M chars (tts-1-hd). 4,096 char limit per request.
close_reason: OpenAI provider fully implemented, documented, and released (v0.3.0). Integration tests (9rd.6) remain open as follow-up.

title: Add CONTRIBUTING.md
description: Add contributor guidelines: how to report bugs, submit PRs, development setup (uv sync --all-extras), quality gates (ruff, mypy, pyright, pytest), testing requirements, commit message format, branch discipline.

title: Fix validation order bug in synthesize-batch and synthesize-pair-batch
description: cli.py lines 225-227: voice resolution happens before JSON input validation. If input file has invalid JSON, user gets confusing 'Unknown voice' error instead of 'INPUT_FILE must contain a JSON array'. Same issue in synthesize-pair-batch (lines 410-414). Fix: move voice resolution after input validation.
close_reason: Moved voice resolution after JSON validation in synthesize-batch and synthesize-pair-batch

title: ElevenLabs TTS Backend
description: Add ElevenLabs as a TTS provider. Highest voice quality (75% preference in blind tests). Voice cloning support. 29+ languages, 5,000+ voices. Setup: pip install elevenlabs + ELEVENLABS_API_KEY env var. Free tier: 10K chars/month.

title: Map ElevenLabs voice IDs to VoiceConfig equivalent
Add ElevenLabs-specific doctor checks (API key, quota)
Add troubleshooting guide to doctor command output
description: doctor command shows pass/fail but doesn't explain how to fix failures. Add actionable hints: 'AWS credentials: no region set' → 'Run aws configure'. Document exit codes and each check in README.

title: Document ElevenLabs rate limitation in CLI --rate help
description: CLI --rate flag help text (cli.py line 123-127) doesn't mention that ElevenLabs ignores the rate parameter. server.py tool docstrings (lines 112-114) correctly document this. Add note to CLI help: 'ElevenLabs does not support rate adjustment; audio will be at normal speed.'

title: Document default voices per provider in CLI and MCP help
description: CLI --voice help says 'Defaults to provider default' but doesn't say which: rachel (ElevenLabs), joanna (Polly), nova (OpenAI). Add concrete defaults to CLI help text and MCP tool descriptions.

title: Document ElevenLabs audio tags in CLI help
description: ElevenLabs eleven_v3 supports audio tags ([tired], [excited], [whisper], etc.). MCP server docstrings document this (server.py lines 103-109) but CLI help text doesn't mention them. Add note to synthesize command help.

title: Rename default output dir from Claude-Audio to langlearn-audio
description: server.py line 52 hardcodes Path.home() / 'Claude-Audio'. Change to 'langlearn-audio' (or similar project-named default). Also update references in tool docstrings (lines 120, 189, 262, 342). LANGLEARN_TTS_OUTPUT_DIR env var already supported as override.
close_reason: Renamed Claude-Audio to langlearn-audio in server.py, cli.py, README.md

title: Make openai an optional dependency (extras)
close_reason: 25-48 MB savings not worth the UX cost. Bare install would produce a package that can't synthesize. Lazy imports already avoid runtime cost.

title: Suppress pydub SyntaxWarning on Python 3.13
description: pydub 0.25.1 emits SyntaxWarning for invalid escape sequences in utils.py (lines 300, 301, 310, 314) on Python 3.13. These warnings print to stderr before doctor output, making CLI output look broken. Upstream issue — pydub uses unescaped parentheses in regex strings. Fix options: (1) add warnings.filterwarnings in CLI/server entry points, (2) pin pydub to a fixed version if/when released, (3) contribute upstream fix.
close_reason: Added warnings.filterwarnings before pydub import in core.py
